alert.note: Alert for Creek; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Osage; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 26 at 10:27PM CST until February 26 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Rogers County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Osage County in northeastern Oklahoma... Creek County in northeastern Oklahoma... Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northern Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... Southeastern Pawnee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Tulsa County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northern Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 1115 PM CST. * At 1026 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles southeast of Slick, moving northeast at 105 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This storm ha a history of producing wind damage and tornadoes. * Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Muskogee... Sand Springs... Claremore... Okmulgee... Wagoner... Bristow... Okemah... Owasso... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Okfuskee... Glenpool... Coweta... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 179 and 247. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Creek; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Osage; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner
